summary: This is an email from an FBI New York Field Office agent forwarding two indictment documents related to the Epstein case: the signed and stamped indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) and the sealed indictment of Jeffrey Epstein (19 Cr. 490). The email highlights the ongoing legal proceedings against both individuals for child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named in the indictment attached to the email (Maxwell_Indictment_20_Cr._330). She is a central figure in the Epstein case, charged with crimes related to child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the sealed indictment attached to the email (19_Cr_490_Epstein_Sealed_Indictment). He is the primary accused in the case for child exploitation and human trafficking.

connections.description: Both are named in separate but related indictments for child exploitation and human trafficking, indicating their alleged involvement in the same criminal enterprise.

events.title: Email Forwarding Indictments
events.description: An email is sent from the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, forwarding the signed indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell and the sealed indictment of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The email contains two attached indictment documents: one for Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) and one for Jeffrey Epstein (19 Cr. 490).
The Maxwell indictment is described as 'signed & stamped', indicating it is an official, finalized charging document.
The Epstein indictment is described as 'sealed', suggesting it was not publicly accessible at the time.
The email originates from the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, highlighting the federal nature of the investigation.
The date of the email is December 8, 2020, which is after Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to his case.
